description: From Middle English coltyssh, equivalent to colt +â€Ž -ish.

adjectives.description: coltish (comparative more coltish, superlative most coltish)

entries.meaning: Lively, playful and undisciplined (often in a manner judged to be immature).
examples: Synonyms: exuberant, frisky, frolicsome, high-spirited, spirited, unrestrained

entries.meaning: Tall, thin and awkward (especially of an older child or adolescent).
